author: Erik Wasson
description: Twenty-eight days after the government shutdown began, lawmakers keep repeating the same votes.
title: End of Shutdown Seems as Elusive as the Great Pumpkin

author: Yang Yang, K Oanh Ha, Naomi Ng
description: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast, how Trump’s tariff war is forcing one US toy company to rebuild supply chains from the ground up in Vietnam
title: An American Toymaker Struggles to Break Up With China

author: Lauren Dezenski, Josh Wingrove
description: US President Donald Trump heads to South Korea on Wednesday for a high-stakes meeting with counterpart Lee Jae Myung, as the leaders seek to hammer out the details of a $350 billion investment pledge at the heart of a critical trade deal between the two nations.
title: Trump Heads to South Korea With Pivotal Trade Questions Looming

author: Erik Wasson, Alicia Diaz, Jamie Tarabay
description: Vice President JD Vance said Tuesday he expects the Trump administration to pay military personnel on Friday, even as the government shutdown shows no end in sight.
title: Vance Says US to Pay Military Troops This Week Despite Shutdown

author: William Standring
description: Most Britons would back a wealth tax according to a survey highlighting the depth of support for a policy Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves has already ruled out ahead of her budget next month.
title: Most Britons Support Wealth Tax, Poll Shows Ahead of Budget

author: Magdalena Del Valle, David Gura
description: US President Donald Trump will follow through and enforce harsh new oil sanctions on Russia to pressure Vladimir Putin into negotiations to end the Russia-Ukraine war, the US ambassador to NATO said.
title: Trump Will Enforce Russia Sanctions, US NATO Envoy Says

author: Josh Eidelson, Ari Natter
description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. directed Centers for Disease Control and Prevention staff to probe the potential harms of offshore wind farms, according to people familiar with the matter, as President Donald Trump marshals his administration to thwart the clean energy source he loathes.
title: RFK Jr. Orders CDC to Study Alleged Harms of Offshore Wind Farms

author: Madison Muller
description: Casey Means, President Donald Trump’s pick for US Surgeon General, aims to quell concerns over her perceived lack of medical experience during a Congressional hearing on her nomination later this week.
title: Trump’s Surgeon General Pick to Parry Concerns She’s Unqualified

author: Galit Altstein
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told the military to immediately carry out “powerful attacks” in Gaza, throwing into doubt a US-brokered ceasefire that’s held for just over two weeks.
title: Netanyahu Tells Military to Strike Gaza, Jeopardizing Ceasefire

author: Daniel Hornak
description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico hailed a decision by China’s Gotion High-Tech Co. to build a €1.2 billion ($1.4 billion) electric-car battery plant in his country even as ties between Beijing and the European Union grow increasingly tense.
title: Slovak Premier Praises Chinese EV Battery Plant in Break With EU

author: Fasika Tadesse
description: Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed has called for international mediation to ease tensions with Eritrea and secure a resolution that restores direct sea access for his landlocked country.
title: Ethiopia’s Abiy Seeks Mediation to Ease Tensions With Eritrea

author: Zoe Tillman
description: Democrat-led states sued the Trump administration over food aid benefits set to end for tens of millions of Americans, accusing US officials of unlawfully refusing to tap alternative sources of money during the federal government shutdown.
title: Trump Administration Sued Over Food-Aid Cutoff During Shutdown

author: Patrick Van Oosterom
description: Far-right lawmaker Geert Wilders’ Freedom Party (PVV) lost its advantage over rivals in the final poll released Tuesday, a day ahead of the Dutch election.
title: Dutch Far-Right Party Loses Advantage in Final Election Poll

author: Erik Wasson
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson dismissed Donald Trump’s repeated talk of possibly running for another presidential term, saying the US Constitution’s two-term limit would block him from such a bid.
title: GOP Speaker Johnson Pours Cold Water on Trump Talk of 2028 Run

author: Moses Mozart Dzawu
description: Ivory Coast dollar bonds gained on optimism President Alassane Ouattara will continue to deliver business-friendly policies in the world’s top cocoa producer after winning Saturday’s elections.
title: Ivory Coast Bonds Gain as Ouattara Poll Win Assures Investors

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump’s administration is slated to sign a deal with South Korea aimed at bolstering cooperation in artificial intelligence, quantum computing and 6G, according to a US official — part of a bid to maintain a competitive edge with China in an expanding race for tech supremacy.
title: US, South Korea to Sign Deal Boosting AI, Quantum Cooperation

author: Allyson Versprille
description: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy warned that flight delays could get worse as the US government shutdown enters its 28th day and air traffic controllers miss their first full paycheck.
title: Duffy Warns of Worsening US Flight Delays as Paychecks Run Out

author: Jimmy Jenkins, Jamie Tarabay
description: Recent cyberattacks on public defenders’ offices in multiple Western US states have spotlighted the technological vulnerabilities of an often overlooked but critical part of the US judicial system.
title: ‘Catastrophic’ Hack Underscores Public Defender Security Gaps

author: Iain Marlow, Maya Averbuch
description: The US conducted lethal strikes on four vessels in the eastern Pacific and engaged Mexico to help with the search for a survivor, in the Trump administration’s biggest single attack on alleged drug traffickers so far.
title: US Hits Four ‘Narco’ Boats as Mexico Joins Hunt for Survivor

author: Magan Crane, Redd Brown
description: The state of Texas sued Johnson & Johnson and Kenvue Tuesday, alleging the companies hid the risks of autism and other disorders if mothers take Tylenol during pregnancy.
title: Texas Sues J&J, Kenvue Over Alleged Autism Risks from Tylenol

author: Erik Larson
description: President Donald Trump formally appealed his conviction on 34 criminal counts in New York state’s so-called hush money case, arguing the verdict was the result of a flawed trial and a politically charged prosecution that sought to derail his 2024 presidential campaign.
title: Trump Appeals NY Hush Money Conviction, Alleging Trial Errors

author: Michael Scott Moore
description: As the Trump administration prioritizes immigration enforcement, representatives from farming districts say they need a creative solution to their labor problems, and fast.
title: How to Solve the US Farmworker Shortage, According to Congress

author: Ellen Milligan
description: The UK is looking to house asylum seekers in industrial sites as well as military barracks and other forms of disused accommodation, Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s spokesman said, as the government seeks to end the expensive and unpopular use of hotels as accommodation for migrants.
title: UK Looks to House Asylum Seekers in Industrial, Military Sites

author: Nicolle Yapur, Vinicius Andrade, Giovanna Bellotti Azevedo
description: The rallies unleashed by Argentina President Javier Milei’s surprising electoral win were stunning, with bond prices posting record gains and the stock market skyrocketing over 20% as investors stampeded back in.
title: Peso’s Post-Vote Gains Wiped Out as Milei Euphoria Meets Reality

author: Olga Kharif
description: Donald Trump’s social-media company is getting into the prediction markets business, where record betting is attracting a host of new entrants.
title: Trump Media Plans to Enter Booming Prediction Markets Business

author: Michael Smith, Myles Miller
description: More than 10,500 officers have joined the program, but some agencies have been more enthusiastic than others
title: Trump Marshals an Army of Local Cops for Deportation Dragnet

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi stayed away from a regional leaders summit in Malaysia this week to avoid meeting US President Donald Trump and having a possible discussion about Pakistan, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Modi Skipped Summit Due to Worries Trump Would Mention Pakistan

author: Olivia Fletcher
description: Ireland’s economy contracted in the three months through September, a quarter that was dominated by US President Donald Trump’s trade salvos.
title: Ireland’s Economy Contracts for First Time in Almost Two Years

author: William Standring
description: Keir Starmer’s Labour Party slumped to its lowest rating on record, according to a YouGov poll that underscored the increasing danger the governing outfit faces on the left from the insurgent Greens.
title: Starmer’s Labour Sinks to Lowest Ever Rating in YouGov Poll

author: Annie Massa, Olga Kharif, David Pan
description: Fresh off its success in the 2024 elections, the crypto industry is amping up its spending power ahead of the 2026 midterms.
title: Crypto Industry Amasses $263 Million War Chest Ahead of Midterms

author: Sam Dagher
description: Riyadh’s annual finance summit draws the titans of global commerce.
title: Trump Bond Puts Spotlight on Saudi Clout

author: Philip Aldrick, Isobel Finkel
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves hired the Resolution Foundation’s Emily Fry and the Institute for Fiscal Studies’ David Sturrock to her council of economic advisers, as she seeks to bolster her operation ahead of a difficult UK budget.
title: Reeves Hires New Economic Advisers Ahead of UK’s Autumn Budget

author: Slav Okov, Irina Vilcu
description: The EU is betting billions of euros that the legacy of Bulgaria and Romania as Soviet-era ammunition powerhouses can be revived and retooled for the future battlefield.
title: Rheinmetall Reshapes East Europe’s Soviet-Era Defense Industry

author: Anna Irrera
description: Stablecoin giant Tether is looking at spending money on US elections as it prepares to open a US entity and is considering options other than the political action committee that has won the support of big US crypto companies.
title: Tether Weighs Splitting From Big Crypto PAC for Political Giving

author: Mohammed Alamin, Simon Marks
description: Sudan’s paramilitary Rapid Support Forces is accused of executing dozens of people fleeing El-Fasher, the United Nations said, after the group overran the city that was the army’s last stronghold in the west of the country.
title: Sudan Militia Accused of Executions After Seizing Besieged City

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat, Pathom Sangwongwanich
description: Retail shops across Thailand are struggling to meet demand for black outfits and muted wardrobes as people enter into mourning for the death of Queen Mother Sirikit.
title: Thais Mourning Queen Mother’s Death Spark a Run on Black Clothes

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: India and Russia have signed a pact to jointly produce passenger aircraft, just weeks ahead of President Vladimir Putin’s visit, signaling that ties between Moscow and New Delhi remain resilient despite mounting pressure from the White House.
title: India and Russia Sign Jet Manufacturing Pact Before Putin’s Visit

author: Tom Rees
description: The UK can reap “huge benefits” from rebuilding relations with the European Union, Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said, as the Labour government seeks to build closer ties with Britain’s biggest trading partner almost six years after Brexit.
title: UK’s Reeves Touts ‘Huge Benefits’ From Rebuilding EU Ties

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Josh Wingrove
description: US President Donald Trump plans to dine with chief executive officers including Salesforce Inc.’s Marc Benioff, Toshiba Corp.’s Taro Shimada and Rakuten Group Inc.’s Hiroshi Mikitani as he looks to tout Japanese investment in the US and wraps his visit to Tokyo.
title: Trump Set to Dine With OpenAI, Salesforce CEO in Tokyo

author: Jenny Che
description: France’s government remains opposed to a wealth tax put forward by the left even as Socialists maintain their threat to topple Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu if there is no significant increase in levies on the rich.
title: French Government Says It Opposes Socialist Wealth Tax Proposal

author: Alex Wickham
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer insisted he wouldn’t be cowed by pressure to approve a controversial new mega-embassy in London, hitting back at recent threats from Beijing which cast doubt on the UK’s attempts to improve ties.
title: Starmer Says UK Won’t Cave to China Threats Over London Embassy

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan unveiled a list of potential projects for its $550 billion US investment vehicle, providing a first look into what specific proposals could be funded by the mechanism that’s a key part of the two countries’ trade deal.
title: Japan Names Specific Projects for $550 Billion US Investment

author: Philip Heijmans
description: Thailand’s top diplomat said the country aims to leverage its peace efforts with neighboring Cambodia — a favorite theme for President Donald Trump — to seal a US tariff deal and revamp their decades-old alliance.
title: Thailand Seeks to Leverage Peace Deal for Trump Tariff Relief

author: Helen Nyambura
description: Imprisoned Tanzanian opposition leader Tundu Lissu said he’s been placed in isolation as the country prepares to hold an election from which opponents of President Samia Suluhu Hassan have been barred.
title: Tanzania Opposition Leader Placed in Isolation Before Election

author: Alastair Gale, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump and Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi pledged to tighten security cooperation and increase defense funding as they visited the aircraft carrier USS George Washington at a US naval base south of Tokyo, an event designed to underscore ties between the countries.
title: Trump, Takaichi Vow to Deepen Security Ties on Aircraft Carrier

author: Patrick Van Oosterom
description: A rising voice in Dutch politics is capturing part of the country’s far-right base, loosening anti-migration leader Geert Wilders’ grip on voters ahead of Wednesday’s election.
title: The Dutch Far Right Fractures as a New Voice Breaks With Wilders

author: Sarah Hilton
description: A man accused of killing former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe by firing a homemade gun at him during an election stump speech in 2022, pleaded guilty to murder in his first trial hearing Tuesday, Kyodo reported.
title: Former Japan PM’s Accused Killer Pleads Guilty: Media

author: Khine Lin Kyaw
description: Myanmar’s military government has detained more than 10,000 foreign nationals over the past nine months who the junta said illegally entered the country for involvement in online scams.
title: Myanmar Detains Over 10,000 Foreigners in Scam Center Crackdown

author: Ellen Milligan
description: In the wilds of Latvia, the British military is trying out new battlefield technology — and how to best integrate ‘the technician and the tactician’ in weapons development.
title: UK Troops Explore the Future of Combat on NATO’s Eastern Flank

author: Rakesh Sharma
description: India’s state-run refiners are considering whether they can continue to take some discounted Russian oil cargoes by leaning on small suppliers instead of energy giants Rosneft PJSC and Lukoil PJSC, both blacklisted by the US last week.
title: India State Refiners Weigh Up Russia Oil Options After Sanctions

author: John Liu, Jing Li, Colum Murphy
description: Chinese analysts expect the US to dial back new export control rules targeting thousands of Chinese firms when presidents Xi Jinping and Donald Trump meet this week.
title: China Analysts Expect US to Ease Export Curbs for Magnet Relief

author: Martin Ritchie
description: The US and Japan have signed an agreement to deepen cooperation on critical minerals, adding the Asian country to Washington’s push to reduce its reliance on China.
title: Trump Enlists Japan in Drive to Secure Critical Minerals Supply

author: Catherine Lucey, Yoshiaki Nohara, Sakura Murakami
description: President Donald Trump hailed the US’s alliance with Japan, reaffirming ties with a longstanding partner and praising new Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi on her plans to ratchet up defense spending as the pair met in Tokyo.
title: Trump Hails Ally Japan, Offers Takaichi ‘Anything You Want’

author: Claire Jiao, Philip Heijmans
description: US President Donald Trump came to Southeast Asia wielding trade deals his office hailed as “historic.” The finer details, though, suggest a set of agreements that are uneven and with plenty of unknowns.
title: Trump’s Newest Trade Deals Give US an Edge Over Southeast Asia

author: Toru Fujioka, Erica Yokoyama
description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent refrained from weighing deeply into Bank of Japan monetary policy in talks, according to his Japanese counterpart Satsuki Katayama, despite having previously describe the BOJ as “behind the curve” on inflation.
title: Bessent Avoids Pressing Hard on BOJ Policy in Tokyo Visit

author: Tom Rees
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ attempt to boost growth by luring in private investment through the National Wealth Fund will be held back by its limited size, according to an influential group of British lawmakers.
title: UK Wealth Fund Unlikely to ‘Shift the Dial’ on Growth, MPs Warn
